Definition: An open-source, functional programming language with an emphasis on statistical analysis and data visualization.
An **IDE** built around the R programming language.
The set of scripts, packages, and data currently loaded into memory in RStudio.
An interactive command line in RStudio that accepts one R command at a time to be executed when the ENTER key is pressed.
A collection of functions available to be installed to perform specific tasks, typically distributed through the **package manager** **CRAN** :octicons-link-external-24:.
A collection of functions that can be loaded into the current R session to extend R's functionalities.
The primary repository for R packages, where users can download and install packages used to extend R's functionalities.

The tidyverse is a collection of R **packages** designed for data science, offering tools for data manipulation, visualization, and analysis, all adhering to a consistent grammar and intuitive **syntax** that emphasizes readability and ease of use.
